title: Pure Damage
body:

Slow and squishy is per the norm for a good number of damage-focused Mages, including my main, Vel'Koz. The ability to deal damage to the whole team that can only be mitigated with a shield or ability that renders one untargetable makes things decidedly un-fun for the enemy team, in particular for those playing champs for whom this damage is ultimately unavoidable, regardless of what champion it is affixed to. Adding an item that grants a spell shield for protection against such abilities makes said ability less of a middle finger to players, but in turn adds a bit more depth to strategy when using both karthus' ult and the shield in turn. Now Karthus players can choose whether to use their ult to force the enemy to blow their defenses specifically to avoid damage from that ability in particular, or perhaps to wait and watch  for when these defenses are used up and nothing then remains between them and unavoidable damage.

I agree except for this:

> not fair that Sivir can block a Jinx ult with her E which costs no mana

This is fair.
Thats just oe of her strengths. She has to time it. Just like any other player has to dodge it. Besides, its probably on cooldown if she's that low and just got out of a fight.

I think what you're looking for is another Duskblade. But instead of dealing damage to someone after a few seconds and having about a 1:30 second cooldown, you just want it to flat-out allow someone to deal PURE damage to another champion. 

Actually, I take that back. You want the old Deathfire Grasp, before Riot removed it because IT WAS BUSTED. Except this one will deal not magic, not true, but PURE damage to a champion. Do you realize what you're saying? Fountain damage is Pure damage. Fountain damage literally ignores everything and just goes straight to your health. AND it goes past passives like GA and Zilean ult. You literally cannot counter fountain damage. You can counter spell shields; just do damage that isn't magic. Besides, this new item most likely won't fit onto the build paths of many champions, making it a super situational item to build against specifically Karthus. He's not even played that much as of now.

And you're implying that Sivir's E is unfair? It's a 20-odd second cooldown shield that blocks the effects of ONE ability and gives Sivir some mana back. The shield doesn't even last for super long periods of time, and you have to time it. If having a shield that just blocks an ability is what you consider busted, then take a look at Banshee's Veil. It does the same thing, and gives some great stats like Health and MR.
